revised_title: The Dioecious Character of Rotifera: A Comparative Study
tldr: This study investigates the dioecious character of Rotifera, focusing on the distinct differences between male and female species. The author highlights the unique features of male Rotifera, such as the absence of a digestive system and the presence of a spermsac, and compares these traits to similar characteristics found in Crustacea. This research supports the classification of Rotifera within the Articulata group.
